dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: A financial market that's like a rollercoaster designed by a mad scientist, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A financial market that's like a rollercoaster designed by a mad scientist, honestly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the Trump Bull Market was one wild ride, with government accommodations and retail investors just flooding in.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the Trump Bull Market was one wild ride, with government accommodations and retail investors just flooding in.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to the governments accommodations, corporations gorged on cheap debt in 2020 to get past Covid. Armed with free trading apps, retail investors bought stocks and options like never before, leading to skyrocketing values in the most speculative parts of the market.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and then you had these day traders outmaneuvering the pros, which is uh, pretty unheard of.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and then you had these day traders outmaneuvering the pros, which is uh, pretty unheard of.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Millions of young quarantining day traders were behind the markets rise, often beating the professionals to buy the dip. While this thundering herd of amateurs is easy to dismiss as they bid speculative stocks to the moon, we believe they are putting some on Wall Street to shame.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But then everything started to fall apart—Tesla lost half a trillion dollars in value, can you imagine?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then everything started to fall apart-Tesla lost half a trillion dollars in value, can you imagine?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla gained about half a trillion dollars in value.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's crazy. And then you've got these SPACs raising over $10 billion for things like electric vehicles and online gambling stocks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's crazy. And then you've got these SPACs raising over ten dollars billion for things like electric vehicles and online gambling stocks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A market for speculative IPOs, called SPACs, took shape so bankers could list electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers and online gambling stocks, which Robinhood traders would promptly bid to the stratosphere. Some 250 SPACs are likely to go public this year, raising over $80 billion in money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, like, feels like a bubble waiting to pop, doesn't it? I mean, valuations written in crayon? That's not exactly reassuring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, like, feels like a bubble waiting to pop, doesn't it? I mean, valuations written in crayon? That's not exactly reassuring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Because of egregious fees and valuations written in crayon, the bubble will likely mint a dozen new billionaires, at least temporarily.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust, which they call a terrible bargain with a 3.6% fee for a portfolio that's down 4% over five years.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust, which they call a terrible bargain with a three point six percent fee for a portfolio that's down four percent over five years.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For a 0.36% fee, you get a portfolio of stocks managed by the worlds best stock-picking firm and exposure to dozens of valuable private startups. Its investments in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent and a few dozen high-growth stocks have propelled it to a 400% gain over the past five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. Meanwhile, Wall Street bankers are being called "most intriguing newcomers," which is kind of ironic twist, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. Meanwhile, Wall Street bankers are being called most intriguing newcomers, which is kind of ironic twist, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. They were betting against innovation and selling the Covid dip, which turned out to be a huge mistake.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. They were betting against innovation and selling the Covid dip, which turned out to be a huge mistake.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although they commit many investing sinsfor instance, hyperactive and speculative tradingtheir collective instinct to buy the Covid dip and bet on innovation was right.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And billionaires got $190 billion poorer in 2020—not exactly a great year for the ultra-wealthy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And billionaires got one hundred ninety dollars billion poorer in twenty twenty-not exactly a great year for the ultra-wealthy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Worlds Billionaires Have Gotten $1.9 Trillion Richer In 2020

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then you've got Berkshire Hathaway underperforming too, down 19% because of their bets on retail and manufacturing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you've got Berkshire Hathaway underperforming too, down nineteen percent because of their bets on retail and manufacturing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Blackstones stock is up 19% this year, outperforming most on Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And David Tepper's firm lost a $9 billion profit on that Ellie Mae deal—just brutal timing with the housing market collapse.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And David Tepper's firm lost a nine dollars billion profit on that Ellie Mae deal-just brutal timing with the housing market collapse.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now, the real estate market is going bonkers, and Thoma Bravo minted a $9 billion profit selling the business to the parent company of the New York Stock Exchange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So now we're looking at a prolonged bear market, with high interest rates and weak household balance sheets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So now we're looking at a prolonged bear market, with high interest rates and weak household balance sheets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stars are lining up for a prolonged bull market as rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets and the eventual reopening of America give tailwinds to the economy and financial markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And companies like Zoom and Amazon might see losses for years, which is a huge shift from their pandemic highs.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And companies like Zoom and Amazon might see losses for years, which is a huge shift from their pandemic highs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even better, the companies that benefited from changes accelerated by the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, Amazon, Prologis and Verizon, should see gains for years to come.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then Forbes names George Zweig as Person of the Year, whose Innovation ETF is down 150% year-to-date.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then Forbes names George Zweig as Person of the Year, whose Innovation E T F is down one hundred fifty percent year-to-date.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And drumroll, please The Forbes Finance & Investing Person Of The Year: Cathie Wood, Founder, Ark Invest. Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, like, that's almost impressively bad? Assets plummeting to $1.5 billion—ouch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, like, that's almost impressively bad? Assets plummeting to one point five dollars billion-ouch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a reminder that even the so-called experts can have a terrible year when the market goes haywire.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a reminder that even the so-called experts can have a terrible year when the market goes haywire.

HostB: Oof. Meanwhile, Wall Street bankers are being called "most intriguing newcomers," which is kind of ironic twist, right?
HostA: Totally. They were betting against innovation and selling the Covid dip, which turned out to be a huge mistake.
HostB: And billionaires got $190 billion poorer in 2020—not exactly a great year for the ultra-wealthy.
HostA: But then you’ve got Berkshire Hathaway underperforming too, down 19% because of their bets on retail and manufacturing.

HostA: And then Forbes names George Zweig as Person of the Year, whose Innovation ETF is down 150% year-to-date.
